metadata.title: CVE-2024-26936 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ksmbd: validate request buffer size in smb2_allocate_rsp_buf()The response buffer should be allocated in smb2_allocate_rsp_bufbefore validating request. But the fields in payload as well as smb2 headeris used in smb2_allocate_rsp_buf(). This patch add simple buffer sizevalidation to avoid potencial out-of-bounds in request buffer.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
